section.title: Function|Insert tangent/normal
section.para: You can use the dialog below to insert or edit a tangent or normal to a function. A tangent is a strait line that touches the function graph in one defined point without crossing it. The tangent may cross the graph elsewhere. A normal is a strait line perpendicular to the function graph at a given point. If the item is a standard function the point is identified by the x-coordinate, while the point is identified from the independent t-parameter for parametric and polar functions.

varlistentry.listitem: You can choose an interval for the tangent/normal. From and To indicates the start and end of the interval. You can leave one or both of them blank to draw the graph from minus infinity to plus infinity.
Here you can choose to show markers at the start and end of the interval. The markers are only used if you have specified an argument range. The default is not to show any markers.
Enter a description to show in the legend. If empty the function equation will be used.

You can choose between different line styles for which you want the tangent/normal to be drawn. You can choose between solid, dashed, dotted or a combination of these. You can also choose the width of the tangent/normal. The width is notified in screen pixels. There are also a lot of different colors you can choose between.
